1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		cmdModule.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description:	The actual module command from the Tcl level. This   **
14   |  **			routines calls other ModuleCmd routines to carry out **
15   |  **			the subcommand requested. 			     **
16   |  ** 									     **
17   |  **   Exports:		cmdModule					     **
18   |  **			Read_Modulefile					     **
19   |  **			Execute_TclFile					     **
20   |  **			CallModuleProcedure				     **
21   |  ** 									     **
22   |  **   Notes:								     **
23   |  ** 									     **
24   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
25   |  ****/
26   | 
27   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
28   |  ** 									     **
29   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
30   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
31   |  ** 									     ** 
32   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
33   | 
34   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: cmdModule.c.src.html,v 1.9 2009/09/02 20:37:40 rkowen Exp $";
35   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
36   | 
37   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
38   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
39   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
40   | 
41   | #include "modules_def.h"
42   | 
43   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
44   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
45   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
46   | 
47   | /** not applicable **/
48   | 
49   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
50   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
51   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
52   | 
53   | /** not applicable **/
54   | 
55   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
56   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
57   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
58   | 
59   | /** not applicable **/
60   | 
61   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
62   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
63   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
64   | 
65   | char	_fil_stdin[] = "stdin";
66   | char	_fil_stdout[] = "stdout";
67   | char	_fil_stderr[] = "stderr";
68   | char	_fil_devnull[] = "/dev/null";
69   | 
70   | int	linenum = 0;
71   | 
72   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
73   | 
74   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
75   | static	char	_proc_cmdModule[] = "cmdModule";
76   | #endif
77   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL
78   | static	char	_proc_Read_Modulefile[] = "Read_Modulefile";
79   | #endif
80   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
81   | static	char	_proc_Execute_TclFile[] = "Execute_TclFile";
82   | static	char	_proc_CallModuleProcedure[] = "CallModuleProcedure";
83   | #endif
84   | 
85   | char	 *module_command;
86   | 
87   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
88   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
89   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
90   | 
91   | /** not applicable **/
92   | 
93   | 
94   | /*++++
95   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
96   |  ** 									     **
97   |  **   Function:		cmdModule					     **
98   |  ** 									     **
99   |  **   Description:	Evaluation of the module command line and callup of  **
100  |  **			the according subroutine			     **
101  |  ** 									     **
102  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
103  |  ** 									     **
104  |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
105  |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
106  |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
107  |  **			char		*argv[]		Argument array	     **
108  |  ** 									     **
109  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
110  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
111  |  ** 									     **
112  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
113  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
114  |  **					control everything		     **
115  |  **			g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
116  |  **						by the current command	     **
117  |  ** 									     **
118  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
119  |  ++++*/
120  | 
121  | int	cmdModule(	ClientData	 client_data,
122  | 	       		Tcl_Interp	*interp,
123  | 	       		int		 argc,
124  | 	       		CONST84 char	*argv[])
125  | {
126  |     int		  return_val = -1, i;
127  |     int		  store_flags = g_flags;
128  |     char	 *store_curmodule = NULL;
129  |     char	 *save_module_command = NULL;
130  |     int 	  match = 0;
131  | 
132  |     /**
133  |      **  These skip the arguments past the shell and command.
134  |      **/
135  | 
136  |     int		  num_modulefiles = argc - 2;
137  |     char	**modulefile_list = (char **) argv + 2;
138  | 
139  | #if 0
140  | 	int x=0;
141  | #  define _XD	fprintf(stderr,":%d:",++x),
142  | #else
143  | #  define _XD
144  | #endif
145  | 
146  | #define	_MTCH	_XD match =
147  | #define	_ISERR	((match == -1) && (*TCL_RESULT(interp)))
148  | #define _TCLCHK(a) {if(_ISERR) ErrorLogger(ERR_EXEC,LOC,TCL_RESULT(a),NULL);}
149  | 
150  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
151  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_cmdModule, NULL);
152  | #endif
153  | 
154  |     /**
155  |      **  Help or whatis mode?
156  |      **/
157  | 
158  |     if( g_flags & (M_HELP | M_WHATIS))
159  | 	return( TCL_OK);
160  | 
161  |     /**
162  |      **  Parameter check
163  |      **/
164  | 
165  |     if( argc < 2) {
166  | 	(void) ErrorLogger( ERR_USAGE, LOC, "module", " command ",
167  | 	    " [arguments ...] ", NULL);
168  | 	(void) ModuleCmd_Help( interp, 0, modulefile_list);
169  | 	return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
170  |     }
171  | 
172  |     /**
173  |      **  Non-persist mode?
174  |      **/
175  |     
176  |     if (g_flags & M_NONPERSIST) {
177  | 	return (TCL_OK);
178  |     }
179  | 
180  |     /**
181  |      **  Display whatis mode?
182  |      **/
183  | 
184  |     if( g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
185  | 	fprintf( stderr, "%s\t\t ", argv[ 0]);
186  | 	for( i=1; i<argc; i++)
187  | 	    fprintf( stderr, "%s ", argv[ i]);
188  | 	fprintf( stderr, "\n");
189  | 	return( TCL_OK);
190  |     }
191  |     
192  |     /**
193  |      **  For recursion.  This can be called multiple times.
194  |      **/
195  | 
196  |     save_module_command = module_command;
197  |     module_command  = stringer(NULL,0, argv[1], NULL);
198  | 
199  |     if( g_current_module)
200  | 	store_curmodule = g_current_module;
201  |     
202  |     /**
203  |      **  If the command is '-', we want to just start 
204  |      **    interpreting Tcl from stdin.
205  |      **/
206  | 
207  |     if(_XD !strcmp( module_command, "-")) { 
208  | 	return_val = Execute_TclFile( interp, _fil_stdin);
209  | 
210  |     /**
211  |      **  Evaluate the module command and call the according subroutine
212  |      **  --- module LOAD|ADD
213  |      **/
214  | 
215  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command, addRE)) ) {
216  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
217  | 	return_val = ModuleCmd_Load( interp, 1,num_modulefiles,modulefile_list);
218  | 
219  |        /**
220  |         **  We always say the load succeeded.  ModuleCmd_Load will
221  |         **  output any necessary error messages.
222  |         **/
223  | 
224  |         return_val = TCL_OK;
225  | 
226  |     /**
227  |      **  --- module UNLOAD
228  |      **/
229  | 
230  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command, rmRE)) ) {
231  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
232  |         ModuleCmd_Load( interp, 0, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
233  | 	return_val = TCL_OK;
234  | 
235  |     /**
236  |      **  --- module SWITCH
237  |      **/
238  | 
239  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command, swRE)) ) {
240  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
241  | 	return_val = ModuleCmd_Switch( interp, num_modulefiles,modulefile_list);
242  | 
243  |     /**
244  |      **  --- module DISPLAY
245  |      **/
246  | 
247  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command, dispRE)) ) {
248  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
249  | 	return_val = ModuleCmd_Display( interp,num_modulefiles,modulefile_list);
250  | 
251  |     /**
252  |      **  --- module LIST
253  |      **/
254  | 
255  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command, listRE)) ) {
256  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
257  | 	if (! (sw_format & SW_SET) ) {	/* default format options */
258  | 		sw_format |= (SW_HUMAN | SW_TERSE );
259  | 		sw_format &= ~(SW_PARSE | SW_LONG );
260  | 	}
261  | 	/* use SW_LIST to indicate LIST & not AVAIL */
262  | 	sw_format |= SW_LIST;
263  | 	return_val = ModuleCmd_List( interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
264  | 
265  |     /**
266  |      **  --- module AVAIL
267  |      **/
268  | 
269  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command,availRE)) ) {
270  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
271  | 	if (! (sw_format & SW_SET) ) {	/* default format options */
272  | 		sw_format |= (SW_HUMAN | SW_TERSE);
273  | 		sw_format &= ~(SW_PARSE | SW_LONG );
274  | 	}
275  | 	/* use SW_LIST to indicate LIST & not AVAIL */
276  | 	sw_format &= ~SW_LIST;
277  | 	return_val = ModuleCmd_Avail( interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
278  | 
279  |     /**
280  |      **  --- module WHATIS and APROPOS
281  |      **/
282  | 
283  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command,whatisRE)) ) {
284  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
285  | 	return_val = ModuleCmd_Whatis(interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
286  | 
287  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command,aproposRE)) ) {
288  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
289  | 	return_val = ModuleCmd_Apropos(interp, num_modulefiles,modulefile_list);
290  | 
291  |     /**
292  |      **  --- module CLEAR
293  |      **/
294  | 
295  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command,clearRE)) ) {
296  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
297  | 	return_val = ModuleCmd_Clear( interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
298  | 
299  |     /**
300  |      **  --- module UPDATE
301  |      **/
302  | 
303  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command,updateRE)) ) {
304  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
305  | 	return_val = ModuleCmd_Update(interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
306  | 
307  |     /**
308  |      **  --- module PURGE
309  |      **/
310  | 
311  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command,purgeRE)) ) {
312  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
313  | 	return_val = ModuleCmd_Purge( interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
314  | 
315  |     /**
316  |      **  --- module INIT
317  |      **/
318  | 
319  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command,initRE)) ) {
320  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
321  | 	
322  |         if( Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command, "^inita|^ia")){/* initadd */
323  | 	    _TCLCHK(interp);
324  | 	    g_flags |= M_LOAD;
325  | 	    return_val = ModuleCmd_Init(interp,num_modulefiles,modulefile_list);
326  | 	    g_flags &= ~M_LOAD;
327  | 	}
328  | 	
329  |         if( Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command, "^initr|^iw")){ /* initrm */
330  | 	    _TCLCHK(interp);
331  | 	    g_flags |= M_REMOVE;
332  | 	    return_val = ModuleCmd_Init(interp,num_modulefiles,modulefile_list);
333  | 	    g_flags &= ~M_REMOVE;
334  | 	}
335  | 	
336  |         if( Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command, "^initl|^il")){/* initlist*/
337  | 	    _TCLCHK(interp);
338  | 	    g_flags |= M_DISPLAY;
339  | 	    return_val = ModuleCmd_Init(interp,num_modulefiles,modulefile_list);
340  | 	    g_flags &= ~M_DISPLAY;
341  | 	}
342  | 	
343  |         if(Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command, "^inits|^is")){/* initswitch*/
344  | 	    _TCLCHK(interp);
345  | 	    g_flags |= M_SWITCH;
346  | 	    return_val = ModuleCmd_Init(interp,num_modulefiles,modulefile_list);
347  | 	    g_flags &= ~M_SWITCH;
348  | 	}
349  | 	
350  |         if(Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command, "^initc|^ic")){/* initclear*/
351  | 	    _TCLCHK(interp);
352  | 	    g_flags |= M_CLEAR;
353  | 	    return_val = ModuleCmd_Init(interp,num_modulefiles,modulefile_list);
354  | 	    g_flags &= ~M_CLEAR;
355  | 	}
356  | 	
357  |         if(Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command,"^initp|^ip")){/*initprepend*/
358  | 	    _TCLCHK(interp);
359  | 	    g_flags |= (M_PREPEND | M_LOAD);
360  | 	    return_val = ModuleCmd_Init(interp,num_modulefiles,modulefile_list);
361  | 	    g_flags &= ~(M_PREPEND | M_LOAD);
362  | 	}
363  | 
364  |     /**
365  |      **  --- module USE
366  |      **/
367  | 
368  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command, useRE)) ) {
369  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
370  | 	return_val = ModuleCmd_Use( interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
371  | 
372  |     /**
373  |      **  --- module UNUSE
374  |      **/
375  | 
376  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command, unuseRE)) ) {
377  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
378  | 	return_val = ModuleCmd_UnUse( interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
379  | 
380  |     /**
381  |      **  --- module REFRESH 
382  |      **/
383  | 
384  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command, refreshRE)) ) {
385  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
386  | 	return_val = ModuleCmd_Refresh( interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
387  | 
388  |     /**
389  |      **  --- module HELP
390  |      **/
391  | 
392  |     } else if( (_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp,module_command, helpRE)) ) {
393  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
394  | 	return_val = ModuleCmd_Help( interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
395  |     }
396  |     
397  |     /**
398  |      **  Evaluate the subcommands return value in order to get rid of unrecog-
399  |      **  nized commands
400  |      **/   
401  | 
402  |     if( return_val < 0)
403  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_COMMAND, LOC, module_command, NULL))
404  |           return (TCL_ERROR);
405  |     
406  |     /**
407  |      **  Clean up from recursion
408  |      **/
409  | 
410  |     g_flags = store_flags;
411  |     if( store_curmodule)
412  | 	g_current_module = store_curmodule;
413  | 
414  |     module_command = save_module_command;
415  |  
416  |     /**
417  |      **  Return on success
418  |      **/
419  | 
420  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
421  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_cmdModule, NULL);
422  | #endif
423  | 
424  |     return( return_val);
425  | 
426  | } /** End of 'cmdModule' **/
427  | 
428  | /*++++
429  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
430  |  ** 									     **
431  |  **   Function:		Read_Modulefile					     **
432  |  ** 									     **
433  |  **   Description:	Check the passed filename for to be a valid module   **
434  |  **			and execute the according command file		     **
435  |  ** 									     **
436  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
437  |  ** 									     **
438  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
439  |  **		 	char		*filename			     **
440  |  ** 									     **
441  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
442  |  **				TCL_BREAK	break command		     **
443  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
444  |  ** 									     **
445  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
446  |  ** 									     **
447  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
448  |  ++++*/
449  | 
450  | int   Read_Modulefile( Tcl_Interp	*interp, 
451  | 		       char		*filename)
452  | {
453  |     int    result;
454  | 
455  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL
456  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_Read_Modulefile, NULL);
457  | #endif
458  | 
459  |     /**
460  |      **  Parameter check. A valid filename is to be given.
461  |      **/
462  | 
463  |     if( !filename) {
464  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_PARAM, LOC, "filename", NULL))
465  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
466  |     }
467  | 
468  |     /**
469  |      **  Check for the module 'magic cookie'
470  |      **  Trust stdin as a valid module file ...
471  |      **/
472  |     
473  |     if( !strcmp( filename, _fil_stdin) && !check_magic( filename,
474  |     	MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)) {
475  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_MAGIC, LOC, filename, NULL))
476  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
477  |     }
478  | 
479  |     /**
480  |      **  Now do execute that module file and evaluate the result of the
481  |      **  latest executed command
482  |      **/
483  | 
484  |     result = Execute_TclFile(interp, filename);
485  | 
486  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL
487  |     if(EM_ERROR == ReturnValue(interp, result))
488  | 	ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_DEBUG, LOC, "Execution of '",
489  | 		filename, "' failed", NULL);
490  | #endif
491  | 
492  |     /**
493  |      **  Return the result as derivered from the module file execution
494  |      **/
495  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL
496  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_Read_Modulefile, NULL);
497  | #endif
498  | 
499  |     return( result);
500  | 
501  | } /** End of 'Read_Modulefile' **/
502  | 
503  | /*++++
504  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
505  |  ** 									     **
506  |  **   Function:		Execute_TclFile					     **
507  |  ** 									     **
508  |  **   Description:	Read in and execute all commands concerning the Tcl  **
509  |  **			file passed as parameter			     **
510  |  ** 									     **
511  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
512  |  ** 									     **
513  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
514  |  **		 	char		*filename			     **
515  |  ** 									     **
516  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
517  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
518  |  ** 									     **
519  |  **   Attached Globals:	line		Input read buffer		     **
520  |  ** 									     **
521  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
522  |  ++++*/
523  | 
524  | int	 Execute_TclFile(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
525  | 		     		char		*filename)
526  | {
527  |     FILE	*infile;
528  |     int		 gotPartial = 0;
529  |     int		 result = 0;
530  |     EM_RetVal	 em_result = EM_OK;
531  |     char	*cmd;
532  |     Tcl_DString	 cmdbuf;
533  | 
534  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
535  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_Execute_TclFile, NULL);
536  | #endif
537  | 
538  |     /**
539  |      **  If there isn't a line buffer allocated so far, do it now
540  |      **/
541  | 
542  |     if( line == NULL) {
543  |         if( NULL == (line = (char*) module_malloc(LINELENGTH * sizeof(char)))) {
544  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
545  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
546  |         }
547  |     }
548  | 
549  |     /**
550  |      **  If we're supposed to be interpreting from stdin, set infile 
551  |      **  equal to stdin, otherwise, open the file and interpret
552  |      **/
553  | 
554  |     if( !strcmp( filename, _fil_stdin)) {
555  | 	infile = stdin;
556  |     } else {
557  | 	if( NULL == (infile = fopen( filename, "r"))) {
558  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_OPEN, LOC, filename,
559  | 		_(em_reading), NULL))
560  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
561  | 	}
562  |     }
563  |     
564  |     /**
565  |      **  Allow access to which file is being loaded.
566  |      **/
567  | 
568  |     linenum = 0;
569  |     Tcl_SetVar( interp, "ModulesCurrentModulefile", filename, 0);
570  |     Tcl_DStringInit( &cmdbuf);
571  |     
572  |     while( 1) {
573  | 
574  |         linenum++;
575  | 	if( fgets(line, LINELENGTH, infile) == NULL) {
576  | 	    if( !gotPartial) {
577  | 		break;	/** while **/
578  | 	    }
579  | 	    line[0] = '\0';
580  | 	}
581  | 	
582  | 	/**
583  | 	 **  Put the whole command on the command buffer
584  | 	 **/
585  | 
586  | 	cmd = Tcl_DStringAppend( &cmdbuf, line, (-1));
587  | 	
588  | 	if( line[0] != 0  && !Tcl_CommandComplete(cmd)) {
589  | 	    gotPartial++;
590  | 	    continue;
591  | 	}
592  | 	
593  | 	/**
594  | 	 **  Now evaluate the command and react on its result
595  | 	 **  Reinitialize the command buffer
596  | 	 **/
597  | 
598  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
599  | 	ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_DEBUG, LOC, " Evaluating '", cmd, "'", NULL);
600  | #endif
601  | 
602  |         result = Tcl_Eval( interp, cmd);
603  | 
604  | 	if( EM_ERROR == (em_result = ReturnValue(interp, result))) {
605  | 	    ErrorLogger( ERR_EXEC, LOC, cmd, NULL);
606  | 	}
607  | 
608  | 	Tcl_DStringTrunc( &cmdbuf, 0);
609  | 
610  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
611  | 	{
612  | 	    char buffer[ 80];
613  | 
614  | 	    switch( result) {
615  | 		case TCL_OK:	    strcpy( buffer, "TCL_OK");
616  | 				    break;
617  | 		
618  | 		case TCL_ERROR:	    strcpy( buffer, "TCL_ERROR");
619  | 				    break;
620  | 
621  | 		case TCL_LEVEL0_RETURN:
622  | 				    strcpy( buffer, "TCL_LEVEL0_RETURN");
623  | 				    break;
624  | 	    }
625  | 
626  | 	    ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_DEBUG, LOC, " Result: '", buffer, "'", NULL);
627  | 	}
628  | #endif
629  | 
630  |         switch( result) {
631  | 
632  |             case TCL_OK:	gotPartial = 0;
633  | 			        continue;	/** while **/
634  | 	    
635  |             case TCL_ERROR:	interp->errorLine = ((linenum-1)-gotPartial) +
636  | 				    interp->errorLine;
637  | 	    			/* FALLTHROUGH */
638  | 
639  |             case TCL_LEVEL0_RETURN:
640  | 	    			break;	/** switch **/
641  | 	}
642  | 
643  | 	/**
644  | 	 **  If the while loop hasn't been continued so far, it is to be broken
645  | 	 **  now
646  | 	 **/
647  | 
648  | 	break;	/** while **/
649  | 
650  |     } /** while **/
651  | 
652  |     /**
653  |      **  Free up what has been used, close the input file and return the result
654  |      **  of the last command to the caller
655  |      **/
656  | 
657  |     Tcl_DStringFree( &cmdbuf);
658  |     if( EOF == fclose( infile))
659  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSE, LOC, filename, NULL))
660  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
661  | 
662  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
663  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_Execute_TclFile, NULL);
664  | #endif
665  | 
666  |     return( result);
667  | 
668  | } /** End of 'Execute_TclFile' **/
669  | 
670  | /*++++
671  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
672  |  ** 									     **
673  |  **   Function:		CallModuleProcedure				     **
674  |  ** 									     **
675  |  **   Description:	Call a Tcl Procedure				     **
676  |  **			Executes the passed modulefile (conditionally hidden)**
677  |  **			and then evaluates the passed Tcl procedure	     **
678  |  ** 									     **
679  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
680  |  ** 									     **
681  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
682  |  **			Tcl_DString	*cmdptr		Buffer fot the Tcl   **
683  |  **							command		     **
684  |  **			char		*modulefile	According module file**
685  |  **			char		*procname	Name of the Tcl Proc.**
686  |  **			int		 suppress_output  Controlls redirect.**
687  |  **							of stdout and stderr **
688  |  ** 									     **
689  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
690  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
691  |  ** 									     **
692  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
693  |  ** 									     **
694  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
695  |  ++++*/
696  | 
697  | int  CallModuleProcedure(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
698  | 			 	Tcl_DString	*cmdptr,
699  | 			 	char		*modulefile,
700  | 			 	char		*procname,
701  | 			 	int		 suppress_output)
702  | {
703  |     char 	 cmdline[ LINELENGTH];
704  |     char	*cmd;
705  |     int          result;
706  |     int          saved_stdout = 0, saved_stderr = 0, devnull;
707  | 
708  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
709  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_CallModuleProcedure, NULL);
710  | #endif
711  | 
712  |     /**
713  |      **  Must send stdout and stderr to /dev/null until the 
714  |      **  ModulesHelp procedure is called.
715  |      **/
716  | 
717  |     if( suppress_output) {
718  | 	if( 0 > (devnull = open( _fil_devnull, O_RDWR))) {
719  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_OPEN, LOC, _fil_devnull,
720  | 		_(em_read_write), NULL))
721  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
722  | 	}
723  | 	
724  | 	/**
725  | 	 **  Close STDOUT and reopen it as /dev/null
726  | 	 **/
727  | 
728  | 	if( -1 == ( saved_stdout = dup( 1)))
729  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DUP, LOC, _fil_stdout, NULL))
730  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
731  | 	
732  | 	if( -1 == close( 1))
733  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSE, LOC, _fil_stdout, NULL))
734  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
735  | 
736  | 	if( -1 == dup( devnull))
737  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DUP, LOC, _fil_devnull, NULL))
738  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
739  | 	
740  | 	/**
741  | 	 **  Close STDERR and reopen it as /dev/null
742  | 	 **/
743  | 
744  | 	if( -1 == ( saved_stdout = dup( 2)))
745  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DUP, LOC, _fil_stderr, NULL))
746  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
747  | 	
748  | 	if( -1 == close( 2))
749  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSE, LOC, _fil_stderr, NULL))
750  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
751  | 
752  | 	if( -1 == dup( devnull))
753  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DUP, LOC, _fil_devnull, NULL))
754  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
755  |     }
756  | 
757  |     /**
758  |      **  Read the passed module file
759  |      **/
760  | 
761  |     Read_Modulefile( interp, modulefile);
762  | 
763  |     /**
764  |      **  Reinstall stdout and stderr
765  |      **/
766  | 
767  |     if( suppress_output) {
768  | 
769  | 	/**
770  | 	 **  Reinstall STDOUT
771  | 	 **/
772  | 
773  | 	if( EOF == fflush( stdout))
774  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_FLUSH, LOC, _fil_stdout, NULL))
775  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
776  | 
777  | 	if( EOF == fflush( stderr))
778  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_FLUSH, LOC, _fil_stderr, NULL))
779  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
780  | 	
781  | 	if( -1 == close( 1))
782  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSE, LOC, _fil_stdout, NULL))
783  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
784  | 
785  | 	/**
786  | 	 **  Reinstall STDERR
787  | 	 **/
788  | 
789  | 	if( -1 == dup( saved_stdout))
790  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DUP, LOC, _fil_stdout, NULL))
791  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
792  | 	
793  | 	if( -1 == close( 2))
794  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSE, LOC, _fil_stderr, NULL))
795  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
796  | 	
797  | 	if( -1 == dup( saved_stderr))
798  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DUP, LOC, _fil_stderr, NULL))
799  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
800  |     }	
801  | 
802  |     /**
803  |      **  Now evaluate the Tcl Procedure
804  |      **/
805  | 
806  |     /* sprintf( cmdline, "%s\n", procname); */
807  |     strcpy( cmdline, procname);
808  |     strcat( cmdline, "\n");
809  |     cmd = Tcl_DStringAppend( cmdptr, cmdline, (-1));
810  | 
811  |     result = Tcl_Eval( interp, cmd);
812  |     Tcl_DStringTrunc( cmdptr, 0);
813  | 
814  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
815  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_CallModuleProcedure, NULL);
816  | #endif
817  | 
818  |     return( result);
819  | 
820  | } /** End of 'CallModuleProcedure' **/
